project_abstract.cdata: The Irrigation Subsector Project will raise agricultural production and productivity by enhancing the sustainability and efficiency of existing public irrigation systems. The project will also help reduce the role of the public sector in irrigation. There will be five components to the project: a) rehabilitation of the infrastructure for approximately 25 irrigation schemes, estimated to cover and area of over 200,000 hectares and reach over 50,000 families; b) institutional development and strengthening of water users' organizations and training of their management in administration, finance, and operation and maintenance; c) an incentive program for technology improvement, including a training program for private technicians, extensionists and farmers in irrigation techniques and practices, fertilization, and pesticide management as well as a matching grant program to encourage the adoption of modern irrigation technology; d) project administration and monitoring; and e) an emergency dam safety program to deal with immediate hazards which significantly affect large numbers of water users along the coast.
